name: Mercure Resort Queenstown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Spacious bathroom. A wonderful scenic view of the lake. Bus service to town on the shopper bus for $4.50. Internet available by the 1/2 hour. Used the gym for a morning work out. Also has a sauna and tennis courts.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a heavenly view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No cons whatsoever. If a room is available, this is the place for you!
reviews.title: Pleasant and comfortable!
Beautiful View from our room
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Queenstown, travelling with another couple who had stayed at this resort in 2005. This hotel is situated about 5 mins away from the main streets of Queenstown, however it was easy to get transport in - taxi fare was around $8 NZ, or the shopper bus called in approx every 30 minutes. We also walked into town several times (it took approx 15 mins), a steep downhill walk but easily done, I don't know if I'd attempt the uphill walk home though, especially after a day skiing!

reviews.title: Great base
reviews.text: We stayed 13 nights in a King Bed Lake view room, with the absolute highlight being the amazing view from our window. The room was clean and tidy with a reasonable amount of space for cases etc. We had a problem with our heating on the first day, but that was quickly fixed once we'd reported it.

Rooms were tidy, if not a little dated. Hotel was in the midst of some renovations, so they are updating as we speak. The view from the rooms and dining areas over the lake and mountains takes your breath away.
reviews.title: what a view...

reviews.text: Staff are helpful and their pub menu hits the spot. There is a shuttle (day fare is available) that runs you to the town, around and back. Makes for good way to go out for supper with drinks without having to drive.
reviews.title: Would not stay here again

reviews.text: This hotel has nothing short of amazing views of beautiful Queenstown! Sadly the rooms are dreadful. The carpet in the 4th floor rooms is all water damaged and in urgent need of replacement. And the rooms need some pretty serious money spent on them. In fact, given that I just stayed in the Mercure Welcome Melbourne 2 weeks earlier I can safely say that all the Mercure hotels need some serious money spent on upgrading. The lobby of this hotel is quite nice but enter the rooms and be prepared to be shocked!!! And my advice is do not eat at the restaurant downstairs. We had a conference there earlier this month and it was just a rip off. Below average food and way too expensive. At least 10 of us had to send our meals back due to the sub standard nature of the meals. The bathrooms are all tired and the beds are hard as rocks. Our conference committee made the decision that our next Queenstown conference will be at non Mercure hotel (and something closer to town!). My advice: for the few xtra dollars you can do far far better and stay closer to town.
reviews.title: Warning - Do not stay here
Great value....great views
reviews.text: I ordered a steak sandwich and side vegetables from the bar. (The place was that quiet that the restaurant was not open). It took 25 minutes to arrive even though I was the ONLY customer there. The portion was small and it was cold. Unbelievable considering I was the only person there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to complain and had to go to the front desk as the barmaid was not in the bar! She was waiting in the kitchen for the vegetables to be cooked as they had not been delivered! Completely inexcusable, appalling service.
reviews.title: awesome view, great value

likes.disliked: — a little bit out of town but travel inexpensive

description: Mercure Resort Queenstown is located on a unique vantage point overlooking the Lake Wakatipu and the Remarkables Mountains. The hotel features 148 spacious rooms with either Lake or Garden views. Accommodation rooms feature broadband internet, coffee and tea making facilities ,in room safes. Facilities include an outdoor swimming pool, spa pool, sauna and gymnasium. Vista a la carte Restaurant, the Lounge Bar, three flexible conference rooms and a winter and summer sports storage room. Complimentary car parking.
